message: Noiz's voice echoes in the silence.
He's still curled up on the floor in front of me.
Is this... how the world feels to Noiz?
This is Noiz's world, where his parents abandoned him and forced him to live alone.
An empty world, a dark world, where he can't feel pain or anything at all.
This is the world Noiz has always known.
His arms and legs are bound with heavy shackles, connected to chains which stretch out into the darkness.
I crouch down and try to remove them.
Suddenly, his eyes open and he looks at me.
I freeze. He reaches out with his shackled hands and cups my cheeks.
His thin lips part, forming a smile.
I can see his red tongue poking from the gap between his lips.
His tongue slips past his bottom lip and down to his chin. The length of it frightens me.
In this colorless world, that red is blindingly bright.
Taking a firm grip on my head, he brings his face close to mine.
I try to pull away... but then, I remember something Noiz said.
He said that only his tongue can feel.
Perhaps that's why, in the world of his mind, his tongue is so long and bright.
The one part of Noiz allowed to feel...
I need to accept it... for only through it can Noiz know the joy of life.
A hot flush blooms on my neck as I open my quivering lips to Noiz.
I lean forward and close my eyes.
Something warm enters my mouth.
Noiz...
I accept you.
Please...
...come back.
